original: Brundin, Carl Hugo Andreas, municipalläkare, Åtvidaberg, f. 11/10/94 i Gbg av tullkontr. Wilhelm B. o. Helena Kollinius. G. 21 m. Dagmar Lun- derqvist. Barn: Gunnar f. 23. — Stud:ex. i Gbg 13, med. kand. i Upps. 17, med. lic. i Sthlm 23. Stud:resa t. Frankfurt am Main 28. Läk. v. Dals Rostocks brunn 19 o. 20, und:läk. v. Spenshults sanat. 21-22, läk. v. Östersunds hosp. 22, und:läk. v. Norrtälje las. 23, assist:läk. v. Sabbatsb. sjukh. två mån. 23-24, tf. prov:läk. i Sundsvalls distr. fyra mån. 24, munic:läk., sjukstuguläk. o. skolläk. i Åtvidaberg sed. 24. Ordf. i hälsov:ndn.
translated: Brundin, Carl Hugo Andreas, municipal physician, Åtvidaberg, born on October 11, 1894 in Gothenburg to customs contractor Wilhelm B. and Helena Kollinius. Married in 1921 to Dagmar Lunderqvist. Children: Gunnar, born in 1923. Completed high school in Gothenburg in 1913, received a Bachelor of Medicine degree from Uppsala University in 1917, and a medical license in Stockholm in 1923. Took a study trip to Frankfurt am Main in 1928. Worked as a physician at Dals Rostock spa in 1919 and 1920, as a deputy physician at Spenshult sanatorium from 1921 to 1922, a physician at the Östersund hospital in 1922, a deputy physician at the Norrtälje hospital in 1923, and an assistant physician at Sabbatsberg Hospital for two months in 1923-1924. Served as acting district medical officer in Sundsvall for four months in 1924, became a municipal physician, health station physician, and school physician in Åtvidaberg in 1924. Also served as chairman of the health committee.
